abstract.para: This is a brief explanation of the various policies that we currently have defined and enabled in our environments.

section.title: Reports
section.para: These reports provide a read-only view of activity that takes place inside of the AWS account that they are installed for. No changes are made based on the actions of these reports.
All reports output results to Cloud Watch and should have a Cloud Watch dashboard for easy viewing.

section.title: Tagged Non-Compliant EC2 Instances
section.para: This report shows the number of instances that have been created that do not comply with the tagging policy as defined here.
This report is effective for the us-east-1, eu-west-1, ap-southeast-1 regions.

section.title: Large EC2 Instances
section.para: This report shows the number of R4/R5 instances currently running in the given account. It does not report on stopped instances.
The intention behind this report is to help gauge cost controls with the Dev and QA accounts.
This report is effective for the us-east-1, eu-west-1, ap-southeast-1 regions.

section.title: 60 Day Instance Runtime
section.para: This report will show the number of instances that have been in the running state for more than 60 days.
The intention behind this report is to gauge longevity of individual instances, as well as monitor the lifecycle behind instances.
This report is effective for the us-east-1, eu-west-1, ap-southeast-1 regions.

section.title: 30 Day Instance Shutdown
section.para: This report will show the number of instances that have been in the stopped state for more than 30 days.
The intention behind this report is to gauge longevity of individual instances, as well as monitor the lifecycle behind instances.
This report is effective for the us-east-1, eu-west-1, ap-southeast-1 regions.

section.title: Unused Security Groups
section.para: This report will show the number of security groups that are currently not attached to a resource, and in effect not used by our systems.
This report is effective for the us-east-1, eu-west-1, ap-southeast-1 regions.

section.title: Risky Security Groups
section.para: This report will show the number of security groups that have 0.0.0.0/0 listed as one of the rules and that does not have tag named SORTicket with a valid SecOps ticket number.
This is to help manage the number of security groups that expose resources to the internet at large.
This report is effective for the us-east-1, eu-west-1, ap-southeast-1 regions.

section.title: Maintence Work
section.para: The following sections describe a lambda function that will execute at least once per day to execute a particular task to change the current state of the resources in the AWS account that they are installed in.
All tasks output results to Cloud Watch and should have a Cloud Watch dashboard for easy viewing.

section.title: Release Unattached ElasticIPs
section.para: This task releases unused or unattached ElasticIPs from the account.
This report is effective for the us-east-1, eu-west-1, ap-southeast-1 regions.

section.title: Delete Old Snapshots
section.para: This task will monitor the age of the EBS snapshots and will remove any snapshots that are over 180 days old.
